extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.original: 4 oz black truffle butter* or 1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalName: oz black truffle butter* or 1 stick unsalted butter

extendedIngredients.name: celery root
extendedIngredients.original: 3 lb celery root (sometimes called celeriac; 2 large), peeled with a knife and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (8 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: celery root (sometimes called celeriac; 2 large), peeled with a knife and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (8 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 3/4 lb boiling potatoes (3 large), peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

title: Celery-Root Purée with Truffle Butter
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Celery-Root Purée with Truffle Butter a try. This gluten free and vegetarian recipe serves 8 and costs $1.55 per serving. One serving contains 334 calories, 6g of protein, and 23g of fat. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. A mixture of pepper, truffle butter, potatoes, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 35 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 44%. This score is pretty good. Try Celery Root Purée, Celery Root Puree, and Celery Root Puree for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                                    Cover celery root and potatoes with cold salted water by 2 inches in a 4- to 6-quart heavy pot, then simmer, covered, until celery root is very tender, about 15 minutes.                                                                            While vegetables are simmering, bring cream, truffle butter, salt, and pepper just to a simmer, stirring until butter is melted.                                                                            Drain vegetables in a colander and transfer to a food processor. Add hot cream mixture in a steady stream, pulsing until smooth. (Alternatively, mash vegetables with hot cream mixture using a potato masher.)                                                Cooks' note:            Purée can be made 1 day ahead and cooled, uncovered, then chilled, covered. Reheat in an ovenproof dish, covered, in the oven or microwave until hot.*Available at specialty foods shops and D'Artagnan (800-327-8246).

steps.step: Cover celery root and potatoes with cold salted water by 2 inches in a 4- to 6-quart heavy pot, then simmer, covered, until celery root is very tender, about 15 minutes.
While vegetables are simmering, bring cream, truffle butter, salt, and pepper just to a simmer, stirring until butter is melted.
Drain vegetables in a colander and transfer to a food processor.
Add hot cream mixture in a steady stream, pulsing until smooth. (Alternatively, mash vegetables with hot cream mixture using a potato masher.)

Purée can be made 1 day ahead and cooled, uncovered, then chilled, covered. Reheat in an ovenproof dish, covered, in the oven or microwave until hot.*Available at specialty foods shops and D'Artagnan (800-327-8246).
